15#ifndef ISC_TASK_H
16#define ISC_TASK_H 1
17
18/*****
19 ***** Module Info
20 *****/
21
22/*! \file isc/task.h
23 * \brief The task system provides a lightweight execution context, which is
24 * basically an event queue.
25
26 * When a task's event queue is non-empty, the
27 * task is runnable. A small work crew of threads, typically one per CPU,
28 * execute runnable tasks by dispatching the events on the tasks' event
29 * queues. Context switching between tasks is fast.
30 *
31 * \li MP:
32 * The module ensures appropriate synchronization of data structures it
33 * creates and manipulates.
34 * The caller must ensure that isc_taskmgr_destroy() is called only
35 * once for a given manager.
36 *
37 * \li Reliability:
38 * No anticipated impact.
39 *
40 * \li Resources:
41 * TBS
42 *
43 * \li Security:
44 * No anticipated impact.
45 *
46 * \li Standards:
47 * None.
48 *
49 * \section purge Purging and Unsending
50 *
51 * Events which have been queued for a task but not delivered may be removed
52 * from the task's event queue by purging or unsending.
53 *
54 * With both types, the caller specifies a matching pattern that selects
55 * events based upon their sender, type, and tag.
56 *
57 * Purging calls isc_event_free() on the matching events.
58 *
59 * Unsending returns a list of events that matched the pattern.
60 * The caller is then responsible for them.
61 *
62 * Consumers of events should purge, not unsend.
63 *
64 * Producers of events often want to remove events when the caller indicates
65 * it is no longer interested in the object, e.g. by canceling a timer.
66 * Sometimes this can be done by purging, but for some event types, the
67 * calls to isc_event_free() cause deadlock because the event free routine
68 * wants to acquire a lock the caller is already holding. Unsending instead
69 * of purging solves this problem. As a general rule, producers should only
70 * unsend events which they have sent.
71 */
72
73
74/***
75 *** Imports.
76 ***/
77
78#include <stdbool.h>
79
80#include <isc/eventclass.h>
81#include <isc/json.h>
82#include <isc/lang.h>
83#include <isc/stdtime.h>
84#include <isc/types.h>
85#include <isc/xml.h>

87#define ISC_TASKEVENT_FIRSTEVENT (ISC_EVENTCLASS_TASK + 0)
88#define ISC_TASKEVENT_SHUTDOWN (ISC_EVENTCLASS_TASK + 1)
89#define ISC_TASKEVENT_TEST (ISC_EVENTCLASS_TASK + 1)
90#define ISC_TASKEVENT_LASTEVENT (ISC_EVENTCLASS_TASK + 65535)
91
92/*****
93 ***** Tasks.
94 *****/

96ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
97
98/***
99 *** Types
100 ***/
101
102typedef enum {
103 isc_taskmgrmode_normal = 0,
104 isc_taskmgrmode_privileged
105} isc_taskmgrmode_t;
106
107/*%
108 * This structure is actually just the common prefix of a task manager
109 * object implementation's version of an isc_taskmgr_t.
110 * \brief
111 * Direct use of this structure by clients is forbidden. task implementations
112 * may change the structure. 'magic' must be ISCAPI_TASKMGR_MAGIC for any
113 * of the isc_task_ routines to work. task implementations must maintain
114 * all task invariants.
115 */
116struct isc_taskmgr {
117 unsigned int impmagic;
118 unsigned int magic;
119};
120
121#define ISCAPI_TASKMGR_MAGIC ISC_MAGIC('A','t','m','g')
122#define ISCAPI_TASKMGR_VALID(m) ((m) != NULL && \
123 (m)->magic == ISCAPI_TASKMGR_MAGIC)
124
125/*%
126 * This is the common prefix of a task object. The same note as
127 * that for the taskmgr structure applies.
128 */
129struct isc_task {
130 unsigned int impmagic;
131 unsigned int magic;
132};
133
134#define ISCAPI_TASK_MAGIC ISC_MAGIC('A','t','s','t')
135#define ISCAPI_TASK_VALID(s) ((s) != NULL && \
136 (s)->magic == ISCAPI_TASK_MAGIC)
137
138isc_result_t
139isc_task_create(isc_taskmgr_t *manager, unsigned int quantum,
140 isc_task_t **taskp);
141
142isc_result_t
143isc_task_create_bound(isc_taskmgr_t *manager, unsigned int quantum,
144 isc_task_t **taskp, int threadid);
145/*%<
146 * Create a task.
147 *
148 * Notes:
149 *
150 *\li If 'quantum' is non-zero, then only that many events can be dispatched
151 * before the task must yield to other tasks waiting to execute. If
152 * quantum is zero, then the default quantum of the task manager will
153 * be used.
154 *
155 *\li The 'quantum' option may be removed from isc_task_create() in the
156 * future. If this happens, isc_task_getquantum() and
157 * isc_task_setquantum() will be provided.
158 *
159 * Requires:
160 *
161 *\li 'manager' is a valid task manager.
162 *
163 *\li taskp != NULL && *taskp == NULL
164 *
165 * Ensures:
166 *
167 *\li On success, '*taskp' is bound to the new task.
168 *
169 * Returns:
170 *
171 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
172 *\li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY
173 *\li #ISC_R_UNEXPECTED
174 *\li #ISC_R_SHUTTINGDOWN
175 */
176
177void
178isc_task_attach(isc_task_t *source, isc_task_t **targetp);
179/*%<
180 * Attach *targetp to source.
181 *
182 * Requires:
183 *
184 *\li 'source' is a valid task.
185 *
186 *\li 'targetp' points to a NULL isc_task_t *.
187 *
188 * Ensures:
189 *
190 *\li *targetp is attached to source.
191 */
192
193void
194isc_task_detach(isc_task_t **taskp);
195/*%<
196 * Detach *taskp from its task.
197 *
198 * Requires:
199 *
200 *\li '*taskp' is a valid task.
201 *
202 * Ensures:
203 *
204 *\li *taskp is NULL.
205 *
206 *\li If '*taskp' is the last reference to the task, the task is idle (has
207 * an empty event queue), and has not been shutdown, the task will be
208 * shutdown.
209 *
210 *\li If '*taskp' is the last reference to the task and
211 * the task has been shutdown,
212 * all resources used by the task will be freed.
213 */
214
215void
216isc_task_send(isc_task_t *task, isc_event_t **eventp);
217
218void
219isc_task_sendto(isc_task_t *task, isc_event_t **eventp, int c);
220/*%<
221 * Send '*event' to 'task', if task is idle try starting it on cpu 'c'
222 * If 'c' is smaller than 0 then cpu is selected randomly.
223 *
224 * Requires:
225 *
226 *\li 'task' is a valid task.
227 *\li eventp != NULL && *eventp != NULL.
228 *
229 * Ensures:
230 *
231 *\li *eventp == NULL.
232 */
233
234void
235isc_task_sendtoanddetach(isc_task_t **taskp, isc_event_t **eventp, int c);
236
237void
238isc_task_sendanddetach(isc_task_t **taskp, isc_event_t **eventp);
239/*%<
240 * Send '*event' to '*taskp' and then detach '*taskp' from its
241 * task. If task is idle try starting it on cpu 'c'
242 * If 'c' is smaller than 0 then cpu is selected randomly.
243 *
244 * Requires:
245 *
246 *\li '*taskp' is a valid task.
247 *\li eventp != NULL && *eventp != NULL.
248 *
249 * Ensures:
250 *
251 *\li *eventp == NULL.
252 *
253 *\li *taskp == NULL.
254 *
255 *\li If '*taskp' is the last reference to the task, the task is
256 * idle (has an empty event queue), and has not been shutdown,
257 * the task will be shutdown.
258 *
259 *\li If '*taskp' is the last reference to the task and
260 * the task has been shutdown,
261 * all resources used by the task will be freed.
262 */
263
264
265unsigned int
266isc_task_purgerange(isc_task_t *task, void *sender, isc_eventtype_t first,
267 isc_eventtype_t last, void *tag);
268/*%<
269 * Purge events from a task's event queue.
270 *
271 * Requires:
272 *
273 *\li 'task' is a valid task.
274 *
275 *\li last >= first
276 *
277 * Ensures:
278 *
279 *\li Events in the event queue of 'task' whose sender is 'sender', whose
280 * type is >= first and <= last, and whose tag is 'tag' will be purged,
281 * unless they are marked as unpurgable.
282 *
283 *\li A sender of NULL will match any sender. A NULL tag matches any
284 * tag.
285 *
286 * Returns:
287 *
288 *\li The number of events purged.
289 */
290
291unsigned int
292isc_task_purge(isc_task_t *task, void *sender, isc_eventtype_t type,
293 void *tag);
294/*%<
295 * Purge events from a task's event queue.
296 *
297 * Notes:
298 *
299 *\li This function is equivalent to
300 *
301 *\code
302 * isc_task_purgerange(task, sender, type, type, tag);
303 *\endcode
304 *
305 * Requires:
306 *
307 *\li 'task' is a valid task.
308 *
309 * Ensures:
310 *
311 *\li Events in the event queue of 'task' whose sender is 'sender', whose
312 * type is 'type', and whose tag is 'tag' will be purged, unless they
313 * are marked as unpurgable.
314 *
315 *\li A sender of NULL will match any sender. A NULL tag matches any
316 * tag.
317 *
318 * Returns:
319 *
320 *\li The number of events purged.
321 */
322
323bool
324isc_task_purgeevent(isc_task_t *task, isc_event_t *event);
325/*%<
326 * Purge 'event' from a task's event queue.
327 *
328 * XXXRTH: WARNING: This method may be removed before beta.
329 *
330 * Notes:
331 *
332 *\li If 'event' is on the task's event queue, it will be purged,
333 * unless it is marked as unpurgeable. 'event' does not have to be
334 * on the task's event queue; in fact, it can even be an invalid
335 * pointer. Purging only occurs if the event is actually on the task's
336 * event queue.
337 *
338 * \li Purging never changes the state of the task.
339 *
340 * Requires:
341 *
342 *\li 'task' is a valid task.
343 *
344 * Ensures:
345 *
346 *\li 'event' is not in the event queue for 'task'.
347 *
348 * Returns:
349 *
350 *\li #true The event was purged.
351 *\li #false The event was not in the event queue,
352 * or was marked unpurgeable.
353 */
354
355unsigned int
356isc_task_unsendrange(isc_task_t *task, void *sender, isc_eventtype_t first,
357 isc_eventtype_t last, void *tag, isc_eventlist_t *events);
358/*%<
359 * Remove events from a task's event queue.
360 *
361 * Requires:
362 *
363 *\li 'task' is a valid task.
364 *
365 *\li last >= first.
366 *
367 *\li *events is a valid list.
368 *
369 * Ensures:
370 *
371 *\li Events in the event queue of 'task' whose sender is 'sender', whose
372 * type is >= first and <= last, and whose tag is 'tag' will be dequeued
373 * and appended to *events.
374 *
375 *\li A sender of NULL will match any sender. A NULL tag matches any
376 * tag.
377 *
378 * Returns:
379 *
380 *\li The number of events unsent.
381 */
382
383unsigned int
384isc_task_unsend(isc_task_t *task, void *sender, isc_eventtype_t type,
385 void *tag, isc_eventlist_t *events);
386/*%<
387 * Remove events from a task's event queue.
388 *
389 * Notes:
390 *
391 *\li This function is equivalent to
392 *
393 *\code
394 * isc_task_unsendrange(task, sender, type, type, tag, events);
395 *\endcode
396 *
397 * Requires:
398 *
399 *\li 'task' is a valid task.
400 *
401 *\li *events is a valid list.
402 *
403 * Ensures:
404 *
405 *\li Events in the event queue of 'task' whose sender is 'sender', whose
406 * type is 'type', and whose tag is 'tag' will be dequeued and appended
407 * to *events.
408 *
409 * Returns:
410 *
411 *\li The number of events unsent.
412 */
413
414isc_result_t
415isc_task_onshutdown(isc_task_t *task, isc_taskaction_t action,
416 void *arg);
417/*%<
418 * Send a shutdown event with action 'action' and argument 'arg' when
419 * 'task' is shutdown.
420 *
421 * Notes:
422 *
423 *\li Shutdown events are posted in LIFO order.
424 *
425 * Requires:
426 *
427 *\li 'task' is a valid task.
428 *
429 *\li 'action' is a valid task action.
430 *
431 * Ensures:
432 *
433 *\li When the task is shutdown, shutdown events requested with
434 * isc_task_onshutdown() will be appended to the task's event queue.
435 *
436
437 * Returns:
438 *
439 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
440 *\li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY
441 *\li #ISC_R_SHUTTINGDOWN Task is shutting down.
442 */
443
444void
445isc_task_shutdown(isc_task_t *task);
446/*%<
447 * Shutdown 'task'.
448 *
449 * Notes:
450 *
451 *\li Shutting down a task causes any shutdown events requested with
452 * isc_task_onshutdown() to be posted (in LIFO order). The task
453 * moves into a "shutting down" mode which prevents further calls
454 * to isc_task_onshutdown().
455 *
456 *\li Trying to shutdown a task that has already been shutdown has no
457 * effect.
458 *
459 * Requires:
460 *
461 *\li 'task' is a valid task.
462 *
463 * Ensures:
464 *
465 *\li Any shutdown events requested with isc_task_onshutdown() have been
466 * posted (in LIFO order).
467 */
468
469void
470isc_task_destroy(isc_task_t **taskp);
471/*%<
472 * Destroy '*taskp'.
473 *
474 * Notes:
475 *
476 *\li This call is equivalent to:
477 *
478 *\code
479 * isc_task_shutdown(*taskp);
480 * isc_task_detach(taskp);
481 *\endcode
482 *
483 * Requires:
484 *
485 * '*taskp' is a valid task.
486 *
487 * Ensures:
488 *
489 *\li Any shutdown events requested with isc_task_onshutdown() have been
490 * posted (in LIFO order).
491 *
492 *\li *taskp == NULL
493 *
494 *\li If '*taskp' is the last reference to the task,
495 * all resources used by the task will be freed.
496 */
497
498void
499isc_task_setname(isc_task_t *task, const char *name, void *tag);
500/*%<
501 * Name 'task'.
502 *
503 * Notes:
504 *
505 *\li Only the first 15 characters of 'name' will be copied.
506 *
507 *\li Naming a task is currently only useful for debugging purposes.
508 *
509 * Requires:
510 *
511 *\li 'task' is a valid task.
512 */
513
514const char *
515isc_task_getname(isc_task_t *task);
516/*%<
517 * Get the name of 'task', as previously set using isc_task_setname().
518 *
519 * Notes:
520 *\li This function is for debugging purposes only.
521 *
522 * Requires:
523 *\li 'task' is a valid task.
524 *
525 * Returns:
526 *\li A non-NULL pointer to a null-terminated string.
527 * If the task has not been named, the string is
528 * empty.
529 *
530 */
531
532void *
533isc_task_gettag(isc_task_t *task);
534/*%<
535 * Get the tag value for 'task', as previously set using isc_task_settag().
536 *
537 * Notes:
538 *\li This function is for debugging purposes only.
539 *
540 * Requires:
541 *\li 'task' is a valid task.
542 */
543
544isc_result_t
545isc_task_beginexclusive(isc_task_t *task);
546/*%<
547 * Request exclusive access for 'task', which must be the calling
548 * task. Waits for any other concurrently executing tasks to finish their
549 * current event, and prevents any new events from executing in any of the
550 * tasks sharing a task manager with 'task'.
551 *
552 * The exclusive access must be relinquished by calling
553 * isc_task_endexclusive() before returning from the current event handler.
554 *
555 * Requires:
556 *\li 'task' is the calling task.
557 *
558 * Returns:
559 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS The current task now has exclusive access.
560 *\li #ISC_R_LOCKBUSY Another task has already requested exclusive
561 * access.
562 */
563
564void
565isc_task_endexclusive(isc_task_t *task);
566/*%<
567 * Relinquish the exclusive access obtained by isc_task_beginexclusive(),
568 * allowing other tasks to execute.
569 *
570 * Requires:
571 *\li 'task' is the calling task, and has obtained
572 * exclusive access by calling isc_task_spl().
573 */
574
575void
576isc_task_getcurrenttime(isc_task_t *task, isc_stdtime_t *t);
577void
578isc_task_getcurrenttimex(isc_task_t *task, isc_time_t *t);
579/*%<
580 * Provide the most recent timestamp on the task. The timestamp is considered
581 * as the "current time".
582 *
583 * isc_task_getcurrentime() returns the time in one-second granularity;
584 * isc_task_getcurrentimex() returns it in nanosecond granularity.
585 *
586 * Requires:
587 *\li 'task' is a valid task.
588 *\li 't' is a valid non NULL pointer.
589 *
590 * Ensures:
591 *\li '*t' has the "current time".
592 */
593
594bool
595isc_task_exiting(isc_task_t *t);
596/*%<
597 * Returns true if the task is in the process of shutting down,
598 * false otherwise.
599 *
600 * Requires:
601 *\li 'task' is a valid task.
602 */
603
604void
605isc_task_setprivilege(isc_task_t *task, bool priv);
606/*%<
607 * Set or unset the task's "privileged" flag depending on the value of
608 * 'priv'.
609 *
610 * Under normal circumstances this flag has no effect on the task behavior,
611 * but when the task manager has been set to privileged execution mode via
612 * isc_taskmgr_setmode(), only tasks with the flag set will be executed,
613 * and all other tasks will wait until they're done. Once all privileged
614 * tasks have finished executing, the task manager will automatically
615 * return to normal execution mode and nonprivileged task can resume.
616 *
617 * Requires:
618 *\li 'task' is a valid task.
619 */
620
621bool
622isc_task_privilege(isc_task_t *task);
623/*%<
624 * Returns the current value of the task's privilege flag.
625 *
626 * Requires:
627 *\li 'task' is a valid task.
628 */
629
630/*****
631 ***** Task Manager.
632 *****/
633
634isc_result_t
635isc_taskmgr_createinctx(isc_mem_t *mctx, isc_appctx_t *actx,
636 unsigned int workers, unsigned int default_quantum,
637 isc_taskmgr_t **managerp);
638isc_result_t
639isc_taskmgr_create(isc_mem_t *mctx, unsigned int workers,
640 unsigned int default_quantum, isc_taskmgr_t **managerp);
641/*%<
642 * Create a new task manager. isc_taskmgr_createinctx() also associates
643 * the new manager with the specified application context.
644 *
645 * Notes:
646 *
647 *\li 'workers' in the number of worker threads to create. In general,
648 * the value should be close to the number of processors in the system.
649 * The 'workers' value is advisory only. An attempt will be made to
650 * create 'workers' threads, but if at least one thread creation
651 * succeeds, isc_taskmgr_create() may return ISC_R_SUCCESS.
652 *
653 *\li If 'default_quantum' is non-zero, then it will be used as the default
654 * quantum value when tasks are created. If zero, then an implementation
655 * defined default quantum will be used.
656 *
657 * Requires:
658 *
659 *\li 'mctx' is a valid memory context.
660 *
661 *\li workers > 0
662 *
663 *\li managerp != NULL && *managerp == NULL
664 *
665 *\li 'actx' is a valid application context (for createinctx()).
666 *
667 * Ensures:
668 *
669 *\li On success, '*managerp' will be attached to the newly created task
670 * manager.
671 *
672 * Returns:
673 *
674 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
675 *\li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY
676 *\li #ISC_R_NOTHREADS No threads could be created.
677 *\li #ISC_R_UNEXPECTED An unexpected error occurred.
678 *\li #ISC_R_SHUTTINGDOWN The non-threaded, shared, task
679 * manager shutting down.
680 */
681
682void
683isc_taskmgr_setprivilegedmode(isc_taskmgr_t *manager);
684
685isc_taskmgrmode_t
686isc_taskmgr_mode(isc_taskmgr_t *manager);
687/*%<
688 * Set/get the current operating mode of the task manager. Valid modes are:
689 *
690 *\li isc_taskmgrmode_normal
691 *\li isc_taskmgrmode_privileged
692 *
693 * In privileged execution mode, only tasks that have had the "privilege"
694 * flag set via isc_task_setprivilege() can be executed. When all such
695 * tasks are complete, the manager automatically returns to normal mode
696 * and proceeds with running non-privileged ready tasks. This means it is
697 * necessary to have at least one privileged task waiting on the ready
698 * queue *before* setting the manager into privileged execution mode,
699 * which in turn means the task which calls this function should be in
700 * task-exclusive mode when it does so.
701 *
702 * Requires:
703 *
704 *\li 'manager' is a valid task manager.
705 */
706
707void
708isc_taskmgr_destroy(isc_taskmgr_t **managerp);
709/*%<
710 * Destroy '*managerp'.
711 *
712 * Notes:
713 *
714 *\li Calling isc_taskmgr_destroy() will shutdown all tasks managed by
715 * *managerp that haven't already been shutdown. The call will block
716 * until all tasks have entered the done state.
717 *
718 *\li isc_taskmgr_destroy() must not be called by a task event action,
719 * because it would block forever waiting for the event action to
720 * complete. An event action that wants to cause task manager shutdown
721 * should request some non-event action thread of execution to do the
722 * shutdown, e.g. by signaling a condition variable or using
723 * isc_app_shutdown().
724 *
725 *\li Task manager references are not reference counted, so the caller
726 * must ensure that no attempt will be made to use the manager after
727 * isc_taskmgr_destroy() returns.
728 *
729 * Requires:
730 *
731 *\li '*managerp' is a valid task manager.
732 *
733 *\li isc_taskmgr_destroy() has not be called previously on '*managerp'.
734 *
735 * Ensures:
736 *
737 *\li All resources used by the task manager, and any tasks it managed,
738 * have been freed.
739 */
740
741void
742isc_taskmgr_setexcltask(isc_taskmgr_t *mgr, isc_task_t *task);
743/*%<
744 * Set a task which will be used for all task-exclusive operations.
745 *
746 * Requires:
747 *\li 'manager' is a valid task manager.
748 *
749 *\li 'task' is a valid task.
750 */
751
752isc_result_t
753isc_taskmgr_excltask(isc_taskmgr_t *mgr, isc_task_t **taskp);
754/*%<
755 * Attach '*taskp' to the task set by isc_taskmgr_getexcltask().
756 * This task should be used whenever running in task-exclusive mode,
757 * so as to prevent deadlock between two exclusive tasks.
758 *
759 * Requires:
760 *\li 'manager' is a valid task manager.
761
762 *\li taskp != NULL && *taskp == NULL
763 */
764
765
766#ifdef HAVE_LIBXML2
767int
768isc_taskmgr_renderxml(isc_taskmgr_t *mgr, xmlTextWriterPtr writer);
769#endif
770
771#ifdef HAVE_JSON
772isc_result_t
773isc_taskmgr_renderjson(isc_taskmgr_t *mgr, json_object *tasksobj);
774#endif
775
776ISC_LANG_ENDDECLS
777
778#endif /* ISC_TASK_H */
